research_goals: To support public health emergency response efforts by making COVID-19 and coronavirus-related publications and their supporting data immediately accessible.
To facilitate text mining and secondary analysis of COVID-19 and coronavirus-related articles.
To provide continued access to and discovery of COVID-19 research to support ongoing research.
To provide perpetual public access to all articles deposited in the PMC COVID-19 Collection for which the copyright holder provides such permission.

experiment_setup_data.experiment_description: The content describes a collaborative effort by publishers and scholarly societies to make COVID-19 and coronavirus-related articles freely accessible in PubMed Central (PMC). This includes making articles available in formats and under license terms that facilitate text mining and secondary analysis.
experiment_setup_data.data_collection_method: Articles were deposited by publishers into PMC. Some articles were made available under Creative Commons licenses, while others were under custom license terms for a specific duration.

results: More than 350,000 articles relating to COVID-19 and previous coronaviruses were made accessible.
Approximately one-third of articles in the Collection were made available under a Creative Commons license.
Custom license terms allowed for access and/or re-use only for the duration of the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency.

peer_review_references.peer_review: Articles were published in peer-reviewed journals and made freely accessible in PMC.
